text: Eleanor Margaret Burbidge (n√©e Peachey), FRS (August 12, 1919 - April 5, 2020) was a British-born American astrophysicist. She was known for her original research and holding many educational posts, including Director of the Royal Greenwich Observatory. During her career, she worked at the University of London Observatory, Yerkes Observatory of the University of Chicago, Cavendish Laboratory in Cambridge, England, the California Institute of Technology, and from 1979 to 1988 was first director of the Center for Astronomy and Space Sciences at the University of California San Diego, where she has worked since 1962. In 2003, Burbidge was added into the Women's Museum of California Hall of Fame honoring her career and achievements. Burbidge died on April 5, 2020 in San Francisco at the age of 100 after suffering a fall. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American astronomers Category:American centenarians Category:Educators from San Francisco Category:American physicists Category:British astronomers Category:British academics Category:British physicists Category:English centenarians Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Scientists from San Francisco Category:People from Stockport
title: Margaret Burbidge
